Package com.clorabase.clorastore

Class Collection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clorabase.clorastore.Collection
  • public class Collection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represent a collection in the database. A collection is the collection of many documents. A collections can have sub-collections in it.

    • Method Detail

      • document

        public void document​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> fields)
        Creates field in the document. Creates document if not already exist. This will overwrite previously written values in the document, So Don't use this for updating values.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the document
        fields - The values to store in the document
        Throws:
        ClorastoreException - If fields contain a value that is not a datatype or if an IO error occured.

      • document

        public void document​(java.lang.String document,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Creates field creating the document if not exist. Updates if already exist.
        Parameters:
        document - The name of the document
        name - The name of the field
        value - The value of the field
        Throws:
        ClorastoreException - There are Many possibilities, Some are :- 1) When value is not a datatype 2) When an IO exception occured 3) When document can't be created for some reason.

      • collection

        @NonNull
public Collection collection​(java.lang.String name)
        Goes into the specified collection or creates if does not exist.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the collection
        Returns:
        That new collection
        Throws:
        ClorastoreException - If collection cannot be created for some reason.

      • getCollections

        @NonNull
public java.util.List<Collection> getCollections()
        Returns collections present in the current collection.
        Returns:
        Collection. A list of collections. May be empty, but never null.

      • getDocuments

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDocuments()
        Returns document present in the current collection.
        Returns:
        Collection. May be empty, but never null

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • getDocumentFields

        @Nullable
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getDocumentFields​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the fields and their values present in the document in the form of Map
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the document.
        Returns:
        If succeed,Map containing fields name as String and values as object, otherwise null.

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes a document or a collection.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the doc or collection
        Returns:
        true if delete succeed, false otherwise
